content.description: Begin on a sit start just to the right of Crippler and 15 feet left of Black Mamba. Climbs ~essentially straight up and great stone and really good moves on positive crimps and slight overhang to highball topout.

The story goes there once was a big bad dog named China...and china got pissed a destroyed a sweatshirt during the first ascent of this boulder. Begins on the face to the right of Black Mamba squat start with L-Hand crimp and R-Hand on good sidepull crimp. Climbs more or less straight up on interesting and balancey footwork to a big throw to a good flat hold on the arching wave feature. Match hands and make a big deadpoint up and left to a good positive L-Hand, get the feet up and do a L-Hand cross to a flat hold and topout/scramble. Highball!https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZVBqu0GR0HI

Huge intimidating line that is "not as hard as it looks". Starts left of Venom/Anti-Venom and climbs up to a golf-ball sized iron concretion and a large commiting cross-over to a jug and a very committing highball mantle. Best to have a good nest of pads and some spotters.
content.location: Big highball on the left side of Mamba wall.

content.description: Possibly one of the most iconic boulder problems in the River Valley and one of the best V6 boulder problems in Arkansas.Climbs essentially straight up the black streak and trends slightly left on the traverse crux  to a L-hand hold just above the thin right trending/faint micro-roof and make a big R-hand hold to a sloper, then head straight up to a relatively easy but commiting mantle. Make sure you save something for the top out. (Best to pre-clean the topout of leaves/pine needles before attempting)https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZVBqu0GR0HI
content.location: Start start in the black streak with a R-Hand pinch at head/shoulder height and high L-hand on flat downpuller just left from the dihedral.

content.description: Awesome link-up starting on Venom doing the first few moves and then moving right and finishing on Black Mamba.
The Holy Grail of Strawberry. High concentration of ultra classic for the River Valley as well as Arkansas.
